item.title: Google confirms data breach exposed potential Google Ads customers' info
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has confirmed that a recently disclosed data breach of one of its Salesforce CRM instances involved the information of potential Google Ads customers. [...]

item.title: 60 malicious Ruby gems downloaded 275,000 times steal credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sixty malicious Ruby gems containing credential-stealing code have been downloaded over 275,000 times since March 2023, targeting developer accounts. [...]

item.title: OpenAI to fix GPT-5 issues, double rate limits for paid users after outrage
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, overpromised on GPT-5, and real-life results are underwhelming, but it looks like a new update is rolling out that might address some of the concerns. [...]

item.title: WinRAR zero-day exploited to plant malware on archive extraction
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A recently fixed WinRAR vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-8088 was exploited as a zero-day in phishing attacks to install the RomCom malware. [...]

item.title: FTC: older adults lost record $700 million to scammers in 2024
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Americans aged 60 and older lost a staggering $700 million to online scams in 2024, marking a sharp rise in fraud targeting seniors, according to the Federal Trade Commission. [...]

item.title: U.S. Judiciary confirms breach of court electronic records service
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Federal Judiciary confirms that it suffered a cyberattack on its electronic case management systems hosting confidential court documents and is strengthening cybersecurity measures. [...]

item.title: Microsoft 365 apps to soon block file access via FPRPC by default
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has announced that the Microsoft 365 apps for Windows will start blocking access to files via the insecure FPRPC legacy authentication protocol by default starting late August. [...]

item.title: Microsoft will kill the Lens PDF scanner app for iOS, Android
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced that it will phase out the Microsoft Lens PDF scanner app for Android and iOS devices starting September 15, 2025. [...]

item.title: Columbia University data breach impacts nearly 870,000 individuals
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​An unknown threat actor has stolen the sensitive personal, financial, and health information of nearly 870,000 Columbia University current and former students and employees after breaching the university's network in May. [...]

item.title: Royal and BlackSuit ransomware gangs hit over 450 US companies
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) says the cybercrime gang behind the Royal and BlackSuit ransomware operations had breached hundreds of U.S. companies before their infrastructure was dismantled last month. [...]

item.title: Fake WhatsApp developer libraries hide destructive data-wiping code
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious NPM packages posing as WhatsApp development tools have been discovered deploying destructive data-wiping code that recursively deletes files on a developer's computers. [...]

item.title: CISA orders fed agencies to patch new Exchange flaw by Monday
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: CISA has issued an emergency directive ordering all Federal Civilian Executive Branch (FCEB) agencies to mitigate a critical Microsoft Exchange hybrid vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-53786 by Monday morning at 9:00 AM ET. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT's GPT-5 models released: everything you need to know
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: After a long wait, GPT-5 is finally rolling out. It's available for free, Plus, Pro and Team users today. This means everyone gets to try GPT-5 today, but paid users get higher limits. [...]
